Headline: No trains between Garfield and Ashland/63rd
ShortDescription: Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between Garfield and Ashland/63rd due to a stalled train at 63rd/Halsted.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between Garfield and Ashland/63rd due to a stalled train at 63rd/Halsted.

Green Line trains will operate from Harlem/Lake to 63rd Cottage Grove ONLY.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

If possible consider the Red Line as a service alternative to the Green Line at this time.

 As a result of the delayed train, shuttle buses are available from Garfield and 63rd/Ashland to provide connecting service through the affected area,

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Orange Line Service Running with Delays
ShortDescription: Orange Line trains are still running with significant delays after earlier signal problems near Clark/Lake.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Orange Line trains are still running with significant delays after earlier signal problems near Clark/Lake.

As a result of the delay, Orange Line trains will be rerouted to the outer Loop (Loop-bound trains will board and exit on the Green and Brown Line platforms at Adams/Wabash, Washington/Wabash, State/Lake, Clark/Lake, Washington/Wells, Quincy/Wells, LaSalle/Van Buren, and Harold Washington Library-State/Van Buren).

  • Also, shuttle buses are still available between Halsted and Adams/Wabash to provide connecting service in both directions and will conclude at 11:45 p.m.

 

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.
